intro: Tessmannia dawei, commonly known as the Queensland boxwood, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage composed of small, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, often in heathland environments. It produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
